intro: Olax quercina, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, dark blue berries. Olax quercina is often found in moist, acidic soils in swamps and pine flatwoods.
